intro: Rhyncharrhena, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Madagascar, and the Indian Ocean islands. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that are often white or pale in color. Rhyncharrhena species typically grow in sandy or well-drained soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. These plants are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value or used in traditional medicine.
